definitions.definition: something that forms a connection between people or groups, such as a feeling of friendship or shared ideas and experiences
definitions.sensetop: bond between A and Bbond with somebody

examples.text: A bond of friendship had been forged between them.
The agreement strengthened the bonds between the two countries.
the special bond between mother and child
Informal language creates a bond between the members of the community.
The students formed strong bonds with each other.
She felt a bond of affection for the other girls.
We try to forge bonds between the different communities.

definitions.definition: an agreement by a government or a company to pay you interest on the money you have lent; a document containing this agreement

examples.text: I decided to invest in some government bonds.

definitions.definition: a sum of money that is paid as bail
a legal agreement by which a bank lends you money to buy a house, etc. which you pay back over many years; the sum of money that is lent

examples.text: We had to take out a second bond on the property.

definitions.definition: the ropes or chains keeping somebody prisoner; anything that stops you from being free to do what you want

examples.text: to release somebody from their bonds

definitions.definition: a legal written agreement or promise

examples.text: We entered into a solemn bond.

definitions.definition: the way in which two things are joined together

examples.text: a firm bond between the two surfaces

definitions.definition: the way in which atoms are held together in a chemical compound
somebody’s promise can be relied on completely
